intro: Monadenia brevicornis, commonly known as the narrow-horned monadenia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its small, pea-like flowers. The plant typically grows in grassy areas and is often found in disturbed soils. It has a short, upright stem with compound leaves and produces small, pod-like fruits. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and somewhat elusive species.
